revision.text:
{{For|other people with similar names|Peter Davidson (disambiguation){{!}}Peter Davidson}} {{For|the song|Sweetener (album)}} {{use mdy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Infobox comedian | comedian = Pete Davidson | image = File:Pete_Davidson.jpg | alt = A close-up of Davidson's face | caption = Davidson in 2018 | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1993|11|16|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Staten Island|Staten Island, New York]], U.S. | active = 2010–present | partner = | medium = {{hlist|Stand-up|television|film}} | alma_mater = [[St. Francis College]] | genre = {{hlist|[[Observational comedy]]|[[black comedy]]|[[insult comedy]]|[[deadpan]]|[[Surreal humour|surreal humor]]|[[satire]]}} | subject = {{hlist|[[Culture of the United States|American culture]]|[[Politics of the United States|American politics]]|[[everyday life]]|[[Sex differences in humans|gender differences]]|[[human behavior]]|[[Embarrassment|social awkwardness]]|[[dating]]|[[World news|current events]]|[[pop culture]]}} }}
'''Pete Davidson''' (born November 16, 1993)<ref name="tvg"/> is an American comedian and actor. He is a cast member on ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''. Davidson has also appeared on the [[MTV]] shows ''[[Guy Code]]'', ''[[Wild 'n Out]]'', and ''[[Failosophy]]''.<ref name=MTV>{{cite web| last=Roth|first=Madeline |date=September 15, 2014|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1931147/pete-davidson-saturday-night-live/ |title=Pete Davidson From ‘Guy Code’ Is Joining ‘Saturday Night Live’ Cast|publisher=[[MTV]]| archivedate=April 28, 2016| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160428232801/http://www.mtv.com/news/1931147/pete-davidson-saturday-night-live/ |deadurl=no}}</ref><ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/tv/episode/5481447/Failosophy/overview "Failosophy"]. ''[[The New York Times]]''. Retrieved September 13, 2015.</ref> He has performed stand-up comedy on ''[[Adam Devine's House Party]]'', ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'', and ''[[Comedy Underground with Dave Attell]]'', and guest-starred in ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]''.<ref name=EW9.15.14>{{cite web |url=http://insidetv.ew.com/2014/09/15/pete-davidson-snl-featured-player/ |title=Pete Davidson Added to ''Saturday Night Live'' as Featured Player |last=Bacle |first=Ariana |date=September 15, 2014 |work=[[Entertainment Weekly]] |publisher=[[Time Inc.]]}}</ref>
==Early life== Davidson was born November 16, 1993, in [[Staten Island|Staten Island, New York]], the son of Amy (''née'' Waters) and Scott Matthew Davidson.<ref name=tvg>{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/pete-davidson/bio/658661/ |title=Pete Davidson Biography| publisher=[[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]]| archivedate= September 2015| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20150930090633/http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/pete-davidson/bio/658661/}}</ref><ref name="sidad">{{cite web |url=http://www.silive.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2014/09/staten_island_native_joins_the.html |title=Staten Island Native Pete Davidson, Son of 9/11 Hero, Joining Cast of ''Saturday Night Live'' |last=Bailey |first=Rob |work=[[Staten Island Advance]] |publisher=[[Advance Publications]] |date=September 15, 2014 |accessdate=April 5, 2015 |archivedate=September 16, 2014 |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140916162329/http://www.silive.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2014/09/staten_island_native_joins_the.html |deadurl=no |df=mdy-all }}</ref> His father was of Jewish heritage and his mother is of Irish ancestry; Davidson was raised Catholic.<ref name=NYTimes>Caramanica, Jon (October 1, 2015). [https://www.nytimes.com/2015/10/04/arts/television/pete-davidson-nuzzles-up-to-the-prickly-joke.html?_r=1 "Pete Davidson Nuzzles Up to the Prickly Joke"]. ''[[The New York Times]]''.</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bustle.com/articles/74445-pete-davidsons-family-background-is-a-favorite-joke-topic-for-him-so-lets-investigate-his-history |work=[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |title= Pete Davidson's Family Background Is A Favorite Joke Topic For Him, So Let's Investigate His History |last=Dachille |first=Arielle |date=April 10, 2015}}</ref> He has a younger sister named Casey.<ref>Steussy, Lauren (December 16, 2004). [http://www.silive.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2014/12/proud_bro_snl_sweetheart_pete.html "'SNL' star Pete Davidson is proud Staten Island bro: Tweets support for sister's basketball skills"]. ''[[Staten Island Advance]]''.</ref> His father was a [[New York City Fire Department|New York City firefighter]] who [[Emergency workers killed in the September 11 attacks|died in service]] during the [[September 11 attacks]];<ref name="nyp">{{cite web |url=https://nypost.com/2014/09/27/the-son-of-a-firefighter-slain-on-911-joins-saturday-night-live/ |title=Pete Davidson, Son of a Slain 9/11 Firefighter Makes His ''SNL'' Debut |last=Buiso |first=Gary |work=[[New York Post]] |date=September 27, 2014 |publisher=[[News Corp]]|accessdate=April 5, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.silive.com/entertainment/index.ssf/2014/09/pete_davidson_5_things_you_nee.html |title=Pete Davidson: 5 Things You Need to Know About the New ''Saturday Night Live'' Superstar |last=Steussy |first=Lauren |work=Staten Island Advance|publisher=Advance Publications |date=September 30, 2014|accessdate=April 5, 2015}}</ref> he was last seen running up the stairs of the [[Marriott World Trade Center]], just prior to its collapse. Davidson, who was seven years old at the time, was profoundly affected by the loss. He told ''[[The New York Times]]'' that it was "overwhelming" and that he would often act out in school as a result of the trauma, at one point ripping his hair out until he was bald.<ref name=NYTimes/> In October 2016, Davidson revealed on ''[[The Breakfast Club (radio show)|The Breakfast Club]]'' morning radio show that he struggled with suicidal thoughts when he was younger, and that the music of rap artist [[Kid Cudi]] saved his life.<ref name=Yahoo>[https://www.yahoo.com/celebrity/snls-pete-davidson-says-hes-053200140.html "'SNL's Pete Davidson Says He’s 'Happy and Sober for the First Time in 8 Years' in Emotional Instagram Post"]. [[Yahoo! Celebrity]]/''[[Entertainment Tonight]]''. March 7, 2017.</ref>
Davidson first tried his hand at stand-up comedy at age 16 in a Staten Island bowling alley, where a group of friends, knowing of his comedy aspirations, dared him to take to the stage. He did so only after smoking marijuana.<ref name=SFChronicle>Vaziri, Aidin (August 12, 2015). [http://www.sfgate.com/tv/article/SNL-star-Pete-Davidson-brings-standup-act-6436362.php "At 21, Pete Davidson is a stand-up veteran"]. ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]''.</ref> Davidson, who has suffered from [[Crohn's disease]] since the age of 17 or 18, at the time said he "cannot function" without marijuana, adding that he would not be able to work on ''Saturday Night Live'', and that attempts to perform without it have not been successful. He explained that he "can perform when [he's] not high, but it wouldn't be that much fun for [him]."<ref name=HighTimes>{{cite news| last=Danko|first=Danny |date=September 30, 2016|url=http://hightimes.com/culture/pete-davidson-interview/ |title=Pete Davidson: 'I Wouldn’t Be Able to Perform on SNL if I Couldn’t Smoke Weed!'|work=[[High Times]]| archivedate=October 1, 2016| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20161001141250/http://hightimes.com/culture/pete-davidson-interview/|deadurl=no}}</ref> He attended [[St. Joseph by the Sea High School|St. Joseph by-the-Sea High School]], then [[Tottenville High School]] before transferring to [[Xaverian High School]] in Brooklyn where he graduated in 2011. His mother still works as the school nurse at the latter. Following high school, he enrolled at [[St. Francis College]] in [[Brooklyn Heights]],<ref name="sidad"/> remaining briefly before dropping out.<ref name=EW9.15.14/><ref name=Diamondback>{{cite news| last=Errigo|first= Michael|date=February 8, 2015| url= http://www.diamondbackonline.com/diversions/student_life/pete-davidson-a-comedian-who-s-one-of-us/article_d77a89e4-aff4-11e4-a273-d7aa4d98cdfc.html |title=Pete Davidson: a comedian who's one of us|work=[[The Diamondback]]| publisher=Maryland Media, Inc.| archivedate= March 5, 2016| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160305013433/http://www.diamondbackonline.com/diversions/student_life/pete-davidson-a-comedian-who-s-one-of-us/article_d77a89e4-aff4-11e4-a273-d7aa4d98cdfc.html| deadurl=no}}</ref>
==Career== [[File:Pete Davidson in 2013.jpg|alt=Davidson looking away from the camera|thumb|Davidson in 2013]] Davidson's earliest onscreen appearance was in the third episode of the MTV comedy series ''Failosophy'', which premiered February 28, 2013. The following month, he appeared in "PDA and Moms," a third-season episode of the [[MTV2]] reality TV comedy series ''[[Guy Code]]'', the first of four episodes in which he was featured.<ref name=MTV/> That June, his first televised standup aired as part of a second-season episode of the [[Comedy Central]] program ''Gotham Comedy Live'', which showcases standup comedians at the Gotham Comedy Club in New York City. The following month, he returned to MTV2 with an appearance on ''[[Nick Cannon Presents: Wild 'N Out]]'', his first of six episode appearances on that show.
Davidson subsequently made standup appearances on ''[[Adam Devine's House Party]]'', ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'', ''[[Comedy Underground with Dave Attell]]'', and guest-starred in ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]''. In 2014, he acquired a role in a Fox comedy pilot, ''Sober Companion'',<ref>Goldberg, Lesley (February 25, 2014). [http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/justin-long-star-fox-comedy-683484 "Justin Long to Star in Fox Comedy 'Sober Companion'"]. ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]''.</ref> but it ultimately did not make it to series.<ref>Andreeva, Nellie (May 12, 2014). [http://deadline.com/2014/05/sober-companion-poster-fox-upfront-presentation-728983/ "We Are... Not Picked Up Yet? Fox Upfront Features 'Sober Companion' Poster"]. ''[[Deadline Hollywood]]''.</ref>
Davidson joined the cast of ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' with that show's 40th-season premiere, which debuted on September 27, 2014. At age 20, he was the first ''SNL'' cast member to be born in the 1990s, and one of the youngest cast members ever.<ref name=Diamondback/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.avclub.com/article/dust-settles-snl-new-cast-member-and-genuinely-hap-209239 |last=Rife |first=Katie |publisher=[[The A.V. Club]]|date=September 15, 2014 |title=Dust Settles at ''SNL'' with New Cast Member and a "Genuinely Happy" Cecily Strong}}</ref> The first new addition to the cast that season,<ref name=EW9.15.14/> Davidson was given a chance to audition for the show through regular [[Bill Hader]], whom he had met while filming a small part in the 2015 [[Judd Apatow]] feature film comedy ''[[Trainwreck (film)|Trainwreck]]''.<ref name=EW9.29.14/> Hader subsequently told producer [[Lorne Michaels]] about him. His debut garnered positive critical notice,<ref name=EW9.29.14>Rahman, Ray (September 29, 2014). [http://www.ew.com/article/2014/09/29/bill-hader-pete-davidson-snl "Bill Hader discusses 'SNL' newbie Pete Davidson, his own hosting debut"]. ''Entertainment Weekly''.</ref><ref>Robinson, Will (May 21, 2015). [http://www.ew.com/article/2015/05/21/snl-pete-davidson-live-tweets-harry-potter "Pete Davidson live tweets his Harry Potter marathon, gives 'dope as f---' review"]. ''Entertainment Weekly''.</ref> with his most noted skits during the season including an ''[[Indiana Jones]]''-style sketch in which he and [[Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson]], after being pelted with poison darts, were forced to mutually suck poison out of each other's various body parts,<ref name="SFChronicle"/><ref>{{cite web| last=Brathwaite | first=Les Fabian |date=March 30, 2015 |url=http://www.newnownext.com/the-rock-bares-his-butt-69s-with-snls-pete-davidson/03/2015/ |title= The Rock Bares His Butt, 69s With SNL's Pete Davidson|publisher= [[Logo TV]]| archivedate= June 1, 2016| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160601115910/http://www.newnownext.com/the-rock-bares-his-butt-69s-with-snls-pete-davidson/03/2015/| deadurl=no}}</ref> an endeavor that eventually found them entangled in the [[69 (sex position)|"69" position]].<ref>{{cite web| last=Wright|first=Megh |date=July 13, 2015| url= http://splitsider.com/2015/07/pete-davidson-looks-back-on-his-weekend-update-debut-and-69ing-the-rock/ |title=Pete Davidson Looks Back on His Weekend Update Debut (and 69ing The Rock)|publisher= [[Splitsider]].com | archivedate=May 18, 2016 | archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20160518035059/http://splitsider.com/2015/07/pete-davidson-looks-back-on-his-weekend-update-debut-and-69ing-the-rock/ | deadurl=no}}</ref> Another involved Davidson being shot in the chest with an arrow by [[Norman Reedus]].<ref name=SFChronicle/>
In March 2015, Davidson was a roaster on the ''[[Comedy Central Roast]]'' of [[Justin Bieber]],<ref>{{cite web|last=McDonagh |first=Ross |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-3017141/Pete-Davidson-slams-comedienne-Natasha-Leggero-Twitter-stealing-joke-Justin-Bieber-s-Comedy-Central-Roast.html |title=SNL's Pete Davidson slams comedienne Natasha Leggero on Twitter for 'stealing' his joke from Justin Bieber's Comedy Central Roast|newspaper=[[Daily Mail]]|date=March 30, 2015}}</ref> and his set was praised as one of the best of the show.<ref>Thompson, Paul (March 16, 2015). [https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/features/dont-beliebe-the-hype-inside-justin-biebers-roast-20150316 "Don't #Beliebe the Hype: Inside Justin Bieber's Roast"]. ''[[Rolling Stone]]''.</ref> Among his bolder jokes was one at the expense of fellow roaster [[Snoop Dogg]] and host [[Kevin Hart]], and their 2004 film ''[[Soul Plane]]''. Davidson, whose firefighter father died during the September 11 attacks, called that film "the worst experience of my life involving a plane."<ref name=SFChronicle/>
In 2016, Davidson was on the [[Forbes 30 Under 30|''Forbes'' 30 under 30]] list.<ref name="forbes">{{Cite web |url=https://www.forbes.com/30-under-30-2016/hollywood-entertainment/#50cc7d23fd27 |title=Forbes 30 Under 30 2016 |work=[[Forbes (magazine)|Forbes]]}}</ref> Also in 2016, Davidson recorded his first stand-up special ''Pete Davidson: SMD.'' The [[Comedy Central]] special was filmed in [[New York City]]. He made an appearance on ''[[The Jim Gaffigan Show]].''{{cn|date=August 2018}}
==Comedy style== Davidson has been lauded for basing his comedy on his own life and employing aspects of his life that have been likened to "a series of brutal truths and vulgar confessions," and which make him relatable to audiences. Touching upon topics such as marijuana, sex, and relationships, incidents he relates include those from his awkward high school experiences to living in a dormitory during his brief stint at [[St. Francis College]].<ref name=Diamondback/> Davidson jokes about highly sensitive subjects, including the loss of his father during the [[September 11 attacks]], because, he says, he finds that it empowers him to address the feeling of powerlessness that experiencing such tragedy at a young age inflicted upon him.<ref name=NYTimes/> He is a fan of the ''[[Harry Potter]]'' franchise, and has incorporated that material into his comedy work as well.<ref name=Diamondback/><ref name=EW9.29.14/>
==Personal life== As of October 2015, Davidson lives in [[Brooklyn Heights|Brooklyn Heights, New York]].<ref name=NYTimes/>
Davidson has his father's badge number, 8418, tattooed on his left arm.<ref name=NYTimes/> Davidson supported [[Hillary Clinton]] in the [[2016 U.S. presidential election]], and on December 5, 2017, he stated on his [[Instagram]] account that he got a tattoo on his leg of Clinton, whom he called his "hero", a "badass", and "one of the strongest people in the universe." Clinton herself thanked Davidson for the compliment, commenting, "This makes it significantly less awkward that I’ve had a Pete Davidson tattoo for years."<ref>Hearon, Sarah (December 15, 2017). [https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/did-snls-pete-davidson-just-get-a-hillary-clinton-tattoo/ "SNL’s Pete Davidson Posts Picture of Hillary Clinton Tattoo on Instagram "]. ''[[Us Weekly]]''.</ref>
He was diagnosed with [[Crohn's disease]] at age 17 or 18,<ref name=HighTimes/> for which he receives intravenous treatment<ref name=NYTimes/> and used medical marijuana as a pain reliever.<ref name=HighTimes/> On March 6, 2017, Davidson announced on his Instagram account that he had quit drugs and was sober for the first time in eight years.<ref name=Yahoo/> During an interview on comedian [[Marc Maron]]'s podcast, Davidson clarified that the only drug he used was marijuana and, while he has since cut back its use considerably, the personal problems he initially assumed were a result of his daily marijuana habit were actually caused by [[borderline personality disorder]], for which he has since been undergoing treatment.<ref>[http://www.wtfpod.com/podcast/episode-849-pete-davidson "Episode 849 - Pete Davidson"]. ''[[WTF with Marc Maron]]''. September 25, 2017</ref><ref>Hautman, Nicholas (September 26, 2017). [http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/pete-davidson-reveals-borderline-personality-disorder-diagnosis-w505457 "SNL's Pete Davidson Reveals Borderline Personality Disorder Diagnosis: 'I'm Depressed All the Time'"]. ''Us Weekly''.</ref><!-- The supposed ENGAGEMENT to Grande has not yet been officially confirmed. Per [[WP:BLP]], please DO NOT ADD it until there is official confirmation by the couple's representatives. -->
Davidson previously dated Cazzie David (daughter of [[Larry David]]) for two years.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://people.com/tv/pete-davidson-confirms-split-cazzie-david/|title=SNL's Pete Davidson Confirms Split from Cazzie David: 'We're Not Together Anymore'|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.thecut.com/2018/06/pete-davidson-apparently-covered-up-tattoo-of-cazzie-david.html|title=It Looks Like Pete Davidson Covered Up His Tattoo of Cazzie David|first=Amanda|last=Arnold|publisher=}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://nylon.com/articles/cazzie-david-pete-davidson-ariana-grande-relationship-win-lose|title=Cazzie David, Pete Davidson, And The Myth Of “Winning” Your Breakup|date=June 15, 2018|publisher=}}</ref> On June 20, 2018, Davidson confirmed that he and [[Ariana Grande]] are engaged to be married.<ref name="USAT Engagement">{{cite web |last1=Mallenbaum |first1=Carly |title=Pete Davidson confirms Ariana Grande engagement: 'I feel like I won a contest' |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/entertainthis/2018/06/11/ariana-grande-pete-davidson-engaged/693041002/ |website=USA Today |publisher=Gannett |accessdate=21 June 2018}}</ref>
==Filmography== ===Film=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable"|Notes |- | 2013 | ''TubbyMan'' | PipeKleener | Short film |- | 2014 | ''[[School Dance (film)|School Dance]]'' | Stinkfinger | |- | 2015 | ''[[Trainwreck (film)|Trainwreck]]'' | Dr. Conner's Patient | |- | 2018 | ''[[Set It Up]]'' | Duncan | |- | 2018 | ''[[Going Places (2018 film)|Going Places]]'' | Jack | Post-production |- | 2019 | ''[[What Men Want (2019 film)|What Men Want]]'' | {{TBA}} | {{TBA}} |}
===Television=== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! class="unsortable" |Notes |- | 2013 | ''[[Guy Code]]'' | Himself | 4 episodes |- | 2013–2017 | ''[[Wild 'n Out|Nick Cannon Presents: Wild 'N Out]]'' | Himself | 7 episodes |- | 2013 | ''[[Brooklyn Nine-Nine]]'' | Steven | Episode: "The Slump" |- | 2013 | ''[[Adam DeVine's House Party]]'' | Himself | Episode: "Stunt Audition" |- | 2014–present | ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' | Himself, Various | Main cast |- | 2015 | ''[[Comedy Central Roast|Comedy Central Roast of Justin Bieber]]'' | Himself (roaster) | TV special |- | 2016 | ''[[Comedy Central Roast|Comedy Central Roast of Rob Lowe]]'' | Himself (roaster) | TV special |- | 2016 | ''Pete Davidson: SMD'' | Himself | Stand-up special |- | 2016 | ''[[The Jim Gaffigan Show]]'' | Jeffy | Episode: "The List" |- | 2017 | ''[[Saturday Night Live Weekend Update Thursday]]'' | Himself | Episode: "4.3" |- |}
